metadata.title: CVE-2017-5016 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Blink in Google Chrome prior to 56.0.2924.76 for Linux, Windows and Mac,and 56.0.2924.87 for Android, failed to prevent certain UI elements frombeing displayed by non-visible pages, which allowed a remote attacker toshow certain UI elements on a page they don't control via a crafted HTMLpage.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5016` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 58.0.3029.81-0ubuntu0.14.04.1172
chromium-browser-l10n - 58.0.3029.81-0ubuntu0.14.04.1172
chromium-chromedriver - 58.0.3029.81-0ubuntu0.14.04.1172
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 58.0.3029.81-0ubuntu0.14.04.1172
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 58.0.3029.81-0ubuntu0.14.04.1172
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '58.0.3029.81-0ubuntu0.14.04.1172').
